question.name: Question 1
question.text: Which of the following best describes an exploring question?
question.correctans: It allows the customer to share information in his/her own style.
question.choices: It is designed to get the customer back on track.|It allows the customer to share information in his/her own style.|It requires the customer to make a specific choice.|It should only be used at the end of the conversation, to close the sale.

question.name: Question 2
question.text: Questions that help you verify information you’ve heard and check your understanding are called ________________________.

question.name: Question 3
question.text: What is an important function of an open-ended question?
question.correctans: To allow the customer to share a wide range of ideas and information.
question.choices: To allow the customer to share a wide range of ideas and information.|To limit the response options and guide the direction of the conversation. |To allow you to keep the conversation going in a specific direction.|To help you verify that you have heard and understood what was said.

question.name: Question 4
question.text: Which is a good example of a clarifying question?
question.correctans: When will you need this order?
question.choices: Do you plan to expand your business in the next 6 months?|Can you tell me a little more about your new project?|It sounds like this bid is a bit of a stretch for your company. Is that right?|When will you need this order?

question.name: Question 5
question.text: When is a redirecting question especially helpful?
question.correctans: When you have a talkative customer who wanders off track.
question.choices: When you need to interrupt and ask a question on a new topic.|When you need the customer to make a decision and select one of a limited number of options.|When you have a talkative customer who wanders off track.|When there are few constraints on the type of response you’re looking for.
